title: Rivian Account Linking Guide | Rivian Roamer
text:
What is Account Linking?
 Account linking connects your Rivian account to Rivian Roamer, enriching and building on the Rivian app experience
 by offering real-time insights, richer historical data, and deeper technical insights that help you understand
 your vehicle's performance over time.
 What You'll Get Access To:
 Software update notifications (often before the official Rivian app) and complete update history
 Real-time vehicle telemetry and status
 Detailed charging session history and analytics
 Drive session tracking and efficiency metrics
 Vehicle health and performance insights
 Long-term data trends and statistics
 How Account Linking Works
 Security First: We never store your Rivian password
 Your credentials are transmitted directly to Rivian's servers and exist only in memory during authentication.
 We store only encrypted tokens that Rivian provides, ensuring your password is secure.
 The authentication process is designed to be secure and transparent. Here's exactly what happens when you link your account:
 Enter Credentials: You provide your Rivian login information in our secure form
 Direct to Rivian: Credentials are sent directly to Rivian's servers (never stored by us)
 2FA Pass-through: Your 2FA codes are passed straight to Rivian
 Receive Token: Rivian validates the 2FA code and returns an access token
 Secure Storage: Only the encrypted token is stored in our database
 Account Security & Management
 Token Lifespan
 Authentication tokens last for 6 months before requiring renewal. You'll receive email alerts before expiration to ensure uninterrupted service.
 Revoking Access
 You can invalidate tokens and disconnect Rivian Roamer at any time by:
 Unlinking your account in Rivian Roamer settings
 Changing your Rivian password (invalidates ALL tokens everywhere)
 Revoking access through your Rivian account settings
 Enhanced Security Option: Secondary Driver Account
 For maximum security, you can create a secondary driver account specifically for Rivian Roamer.
 This isolates access from your primary account while maintaining full functionality.
 How to Set Up a Secondary Account:
 You can use "plus aliasing" with your existing email (e.g., yourname+rr@email.com) to create
 a new Rivian account without setting up a new email address. This secondary account will be used exclusively
 for Rivian Roamer.
 Create the secondary account: Sign up for a new Rivian account using your plus-aliased email
 Open the Rivian App on your phone (logged in with your primary account)
 Scroll down and select Drivers and Keys
 Tap on the Share Vehicle Access button
 Tap on Invite a Driver and Next
 Enter your secondary account email and tap Invite Driver
 Important: Accept the invitation sent to your secondary email address
 Link the secondary account to Rivian Roamer instead of your primary account
 Note: Repeat steps 2-7 for each vehicle you want to monitor in Rivian Roamer.
 If you purchase a new vehicle in the future, remember to invite your secondary account as a driver for that vehicle too.
 Location Privacy and Secondary Accounts
 Applies to: Rivian Roamer Plus (drive and charging maps)
 If the linked Rivian account has the Hide Location setting enabled in the Rivian app,
 Rivian Roamer cannot receive vehicle location data. Drive and charging sessions will record, but
 maps and location-based insights will be unavailable until location sharing is re-enabled.
 When this matters
 This most commonly affects users who link a secondary driver account for Rivian Roamer.
 If that secondary account has Hide Location turned on, Roamer will not receive location for that vehicle.
 What youâ€™ll see in Roamer
 No map for drive sessions
 No map for charging sessions and reduced location context
 Limited location-derived insights (e.g., at-home detection, route context)
 How to confirm or fix
 Open your Rivian app
 Scroll down to and tap on Location
 Confirm Hide Location is toggled OFF
 Changes may take a few minutes to reflect. After turning off Hide Location, start a short drive or
 plug in to a charger to generate fresh data with location.
